why splitting ? anyone still use CD-R ?

@beikercol : Why not take a very simple approach. I assume your media player has a "PLAYLIST"? This lets you watch many movies or video clips or whatever, in the order you place them in. SO. . . put in the 1st movie to play, the "disc 1", then in the 2nd line (2nd movie to play), place the "disc 2". When you hit PLAY, it will play the 1st selection, then it will immediately begin the 2nd selection (or disc 2 in this example). This is the easiest way to have it playback as if it was NOT on separate files/discs. If this type of fix to get around a movie being uploaded in 2 parts is completely foreign and mind blowing, perhaps block buster or NET FLICKS is a better way for you to go as far as movie watching. I can't see the big deal???? a movie being spread over 2 files or 'disks' is not even a real issue. 

Its like saying, "My computer is hard to use because to make capital letters when I type I have to use that damn annoying SHIFT KEY" !!!! WHY can't it just KNOW I need a capital letter at that moment!!! "cry cry cry",  "whine whine whine". 
Not to be mean, but I don't see any real problem???? 
It's amazing this guy/gal was even able to download the torrent with success. Playing 1 file immediately after another is EASIER then downloading the file to begin with?? Go figure??
